Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In a double blind , crossover study 6 h infusions of adrenaline ( 15 ng / kg / min ; 1 ng = 5 . 458 pmol ) , noradrenaline ( 30 ng / kg / min ; 1 ng = 5 . 911 pmol ) , and a 5 % dextrose solution ( 5 . 4 ml / h ) , were given to ten healthy volunteers in random order 2 weeks apart .

Let's think step by step.

The paragraph does not mention any disease entities. It describes a medical study involving the infusion of adrenaline, noradrenaline, and a dextrose solution to ten healthy volunteers.

Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In a double blind , crossover study 6 h infusions of adrenaline ( 15 ng / kg / min ; 1 ng = 5 . 458 pmol ) , noradrenaline ( 30 ng / kg / min ; 1 ng = 5 . 911 pmol ) , and a 5 % dextrose solution ( 5 . 4 ml / h ) , were given to ten healthy volunteers in random order 2 weeks apart .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| adrenaline |
| 15 ng / kg / min |
| 1 ng |
| 5 . 458 pmol |
| noradrenaline |
| 30 ng / kg / min |
| 1 ng |
| 5 . 911 pmol |
| 5 % dextrose solution |
| 5 . 4 ml / h |

Explanation:

1. adrenaline
2. 15 ng / kg / min (this is a rate of infusion of adrenaline, but it is specified as a single entity in the text)
3. 1 ng (this is a unit of measurement for adrenaline and noradrenaline)
4. 5 . 458 pmol (this is a unit of measurement for adrenaline)
5. noradrenaline
6. 30 ng / kg / min (this is a rate of infusion of noradrenaline, but it is specified as a single entity in the text)
7. 5 . 911 pmol (this is a unit of measurement for noradrenaline)
8. 5 % dextrose solution
9. 5 . 4 ml / h (this is a rate of infusion of the dextrose solution, but it is specified as a single entity in the text)
